description.narrative:
Focus Area 1: Political Dialogue and Peacebuilding is aimed at reinforcing peace initiatives in Syria and reconciliation efforts in Iraq, thereby countering ISIL and other extremist groups and promoting the role of moderate actors. A key priority is the support to the political process led by the UN to promote a peaceful solution to the conflict in Syria and the support to civil society organisations that play a key role in anchoring a future political agreement and can serve as an important building stone for a democratic Syria.
The following engagements are supported under Focus Area 1: The UN Special Envoy for Syria (UNDPA), Syrian civil society centre, Baytna, The Day After (TDA), The International, Impartial and Independent Mechanism (IIIM), Commission for International Justice and Accountability (CIJA) and UNDP; support for Integrated Reconciliation in Iraq.
Focus Area 2: Resilience and Rapid Response is aimed at enhancing community resilience and return of IDPs through mine clearance, improved access and provision of priority services in former ISIL-held areas of Iraq and areas under moderate opposition control in Syria.
The following engagements are supported under Focus Area 2: The Syria Recovery Trust Fund (SRTF), The UN Funding Facility for Stabilization (FFS), United Nations Mine Action Service (UNMAS), Sterling/Janus; Conventional weapons destruction in Anbar province and Tetra Tech; Mine clearance in Raqqa province.
Focus Area 3: Community Security and Governance provides a framework to strengthen community security and the promotion of inclusive governance by moderate actors in Syria and the Government in Iraq.
The following engagements are supported under Focus Area 3: The Access to Justice and Community Security Programme (AJACS), Syria Civil Defence/”White Helmets” and UNDP; support to Security Sector Reform in Iraq.
